In some cases it would be better if children had less work in the school and more training in the performance of home duties. Above all else they should be taught to be thoughtful and helpful. Many things to be learned from books are far less essential than the lessons of practical industry and discipline.--Ms. 126, 1903, pp. 1-3, 6-7. ("Christ at the Marriage Feast," October 26, 1903.) 

White Estate, Washington, D. C. August 19, 1980
